at Team which includes participation from all operating departments and all employee levels. Every Hazmat Team member has received a minimum of 24 hours of HAZWOPER training per 29 CFR 1910.120(q), with most members receiving the required 40-hour HAZWOPER training for hazardous substance removal. Training is provided by a variety of resources. They may include one or more of the following: third party training professionals, online courses, and in-house classroom sessions. Training is also supplemented with hands on experience along with appropriate response information regarding new chemicals or procedures. The on-site CCI Hazmat Team can handle most releases. There is the potential for significant incidents that are beyond the scope of our internal hazmat team, and aid would be sought from professional hazmat response services.

Facility - 
The CCI Phoenix facility is completely covered by an ESFR sprinkler system. The general production and warehouse are fully contained within the building which includes a dike to contain any possible spill within the designated area and inside the building.

The CCI - Phoenix facility is approximately 2.5 miles (6 minutes) from the nearest Phoenix Fire Department (station 14). The nearest hospital is approximately 4.6 miles (12 minutes).

Regulated Substances - 
Columbus Chemical in Phoenix, AZ contains one process for one regulated substance. This process of storage is covered for Hydrofluoric acid 50% or over. The reason for including Hydrofluoric acid in the storage process is due to an expected increase in inventory for new business which will consistently bring inventory over the threshold quantity.
Hydrofluoric acid is purchased between 50-70% HF in drums or IBC totes (for 60% or under). Total net weights of each container will vary, but the maximum amount in a single vessel will be 2205 pounds in an IBC tote. This quantity meets the threshold in the single vessel. Each drum contains 450-550 pounds of solution. Because the

 Strive for continuous improvement in everything we do.

 Dedicate the necessary resources to sustain this policy.

In addition to our verification with NACD, CCI has a Management Commitment to the NACD Responsible Distribution Guiding Principles approved and signed by senior management. This internal policy affirms our commitment to abide by the nine Guiding Principles of NACD Responsible Distribution.

CCI has a Corporate Social Responsibility Program approved and signed by senior management. Besides the areas of human rights, labor and anti-corruption, this program also puts focus on CCIs corporate social responsibility regarding the environment. The three main commitments to this section are to:
 Support a precautionary approach to environmental challenges.
 Undertake initiatives to promote greater environmental responsibility.
 Encourage the development and diffusion of environmentally friendly technologies.

Accidental release prevention -
Accidental release of chemicals is prevented and mitigated by ongoing employee training, strict inventory practices, standard operating procedures, detailed maintenance practices, and systems to control processes. 
Emergency response activities are addressed in multiple documents, both developed by the facility and developed jointly with cooperating agencies. These activities are reinforced by ongoing training, by the related day-to-day experience entailed in basic CCI operations, and by the many inspections and audits to which CCI is subjected by local, state, and federal government agencies, insurance companies, and customers.

There have been no incidents for which the threshold of a regulated substance has been released from the facility.

Brief overview / corporate certifications - 
Columbus Chemical Industries, Inc. (CCI) formulates, blends, packages and distributes a wide variety of chemicals for many different industrial, commercial, and educational applications. CCI has been in business for over 40 years and is pleased to have many long-term customers and employees. CCI managers have vast industry experience with chemicals. CCI has long been certified to the quality standards of ISO 9001, most recently reissued in April 2021. CCI has also continued to be verified in the comprehensive Responsible Distribution program of the National Association of Chemical Distributors (NACD). The NACD Verification cycle is every three years, and CCI was most recently verified in September 2021.

Corporate safety policies - 
CCI's overall Quality Policy, which all employees are expected to remember and/or be able to reference at any moment, states:
Columbus Chemical Industries safely manufactures products that meet or exceed customer specification while providing exceptional service by focusing on continuous improvement.

CCI has a Safety, Environmental Protection, Sustainability, and Security Policy approved and signed by senior management. This policy states:
Columbus Chemical Industries, Inc. is committed to the safety of our employees and the community; to maintaining the highest standards of environmental stewardship; to operation sustainably; and to safeguarding the security of our associates, facilities, industry, community, and country. To that end, CCI commits to the following principles and practices:
 Embrace safety, environmental stewardship, sustainability, and security in our guiding core values, including the principles of the National Association of Chemical Distributors Responsible Distribution.
 Practice openness, honesty, and integrity in everything we do.
 Maintain the highest levels of proactive chemical management.
